page.title: 02LANDSCAPE_ EGMANTON & LAXTON
page.content: This predominantly rural area is complicated by two factors:_ 1: The history which is reflected in the Medieval three field system which is preserved and still operated at Laxton. 2: The oilfield which underlies the area. The villages of Laxton, Egmanton and Moorhouse are still very small and residential land use is secondary to the farming user in terms of area covered. The map shows that on the higher land between 77 and 38 metres arable crops including wheat, barley, oil seed rape and rye are grown. On the lower land between 30 and 16 metres in the valleys of the small streams, grassland supports cattle and ponies. The population of the area is less than 500. 3 squares are uninhabited.
